feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Get the price for a material without simulating sales order
entry.content: We want to get the price of a material without simulating the sales order via BAPI. Currently we are using BAPI_PIQ_SDPRICELIST  to get the net price of a material but it is simulating the sales order and providing the price which is causing the performance issue. We need it for multiple materials at one go but it is taking longer time. is there anyway we can get the net price directly from the table rather than BAPI.

entry.title: CAMT.053.001.08 FIEB_CAMT053_V8_CH_TO_FEB Umlauts
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we have the following situation. We have set up CAMT.053.001.08 FIEB_CAMT053_V8_CH_TO_FEB. However, the special German characters (umlauts) in the payment reference are not displayed correctly. We checked the encoding in both the source and the transformation, and it matches. Has anyone else encountered this issue? Do we really need to copy and customize the transformation specifically for the payment reference field, or did we simply overlook a setting?


Thank you,
Sebastian

entry.title: Incorrect Quantity / Weight Conversion during Outbound Delivery Creation
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are experiencing an issue during Outbound Delivery creation from Sales Order.

Issue description:

  • The Outbound Delivery is created successfully without any error or dump.

  • However, the delivery quantity / weight after unit conversion is incorrect compared to the expected value.

  • The issue occurs during UoM to weight conversion in delivery creation.

Investigation done:

  • ABAP debugging was performed, and no custom code is involved in the quantity/weight calculation.

  • The issue is suspected to be caused by standard SAP logic or customizing settings.

Could you please help us clarify this issue?

Thanks,

 

Note: I have adjusted this post to add more details.

Please find the screenshots showing the material with an incorrect weight.
The base unit of measure is CAY, with alternative units BO, M, and KG.

The sales order was created using unit BO.
In the sales order, 25 BO equals 50 CAY, which corresponds to 310.500 KG.

However, when the outbound delivery is created, the delivery quantity in PUoM is 308.093 KG instead of 310.500 KG.

Please review the attached screenshots for further details.

entry.title: Add more types of retention in PO SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

Is there a way to use several types of retention in a purchase order?
In the standard system, there is only one retention field expressed as a percentage. My requirement is to have three retention fields with amounts (RE01, RE02, RE03) in the purchase order.

Thank you.

entry.title: Upgrade S/4HANA 1809 FP2 – 2021 SP3 SDMI Downtime Optimization
entry.content:
Introduction

In many S/4HANA upgrade programs, the focus is heavily placed on completing SUM successfully. However, in large enterprise systems, the real risk to downtime and cutover stability often comes after SUM execution begins, specifically from Silent Data Migration Interface (SDMI).

SDMI is designed to move data conversion out of technical downtime and into uptime wherever possible. In practice, when SDMI is not architected deliberately, it can extend downtime, overload the database, and delay business validation—especially in systems processing hundreds of millions or billions of records.

This article shares practical, field-tested experience from a large-scale S/4HANA upgrade where SDMI initially ran for multiple days and later was reduced to single-digit hours through architectural changes rather than trial-and-error tuning.

Why SDMI Becomes a Critical Risk Area

In high-volume systems, SDMI often becomes the longest-running activity during or immediately after the upgrade. Common symptoms include:

  • SDMI classes running for days during SUM post-processing

  • Unpredictable execution behavior across upgrade cycles

  • Heavy database update statements dominating runtime

  • Business validation blocked until SDMI completion

In this project, SDMI classes related to Commodity Management and Agricultural Contract Management processed over a billion records, making default SDMI execution paths impractical from a business downtime perspective.

The key realization was that SDMI is not a background task—it is a core upgrade workstream that requires architectural ownership.

Understanding Where SDMI Fits in the SUM Lifecycle

By default, SDMI can execute in several places:

  • During SUM uptime phases

  • At the SUM breakpoint RUN_SDMI_POST_PROCESSING

  • Outside SUM, executed manually or via background jobs

For smaller systems, running SDMI inside SUM may be acceptable. For large systems, allowing heavy SDMI classes to execute within SUM can consume the entire cutover window.

In early upgrade cycles, SDMI execution at the post-processing breakpoint extended SUM completion by multiple days, directly impacting SPAU/SPDD activities and delaying business sign-off.

 

Architectural Decision: Decouple Heavy SDMI from SUM

Rather than continuing to tune within SUM, the approach was changed fundamentally:

  • Light SDMI classes remained inside SUM

  • High-volume SDMI classes were deliberately excluded from SUM execution

  • Heavy classes were executed outside SUM during controlled uptime windows

This architectural separation achieved three important outcomes:

  1. Protected SUM technical downtime

  2. Allowed performance tuning without SUM constraints

  3. Enabled better monitoring, restart, and recovery options

The upgrade moved from a “hope-and-wait” model to a controlled execution strategy.

 

Performance Optimization Beyond Parallelism

Increasing work processes alone did not resolve SDMI performance issues. The biggest improvements came from addressing database behavior and SDMI framework logic.

Key actions included:

  • Applying targeted SAP Notes addressing SDMI performance and SQL optimization

  • Reducing unnecessary updates by skipping already “realized” records

  • Resetting SDMI migration state correctly before reprocessing

  • Monitoring SQL execution time using ST12 and database tools

Once database-level inefficiencies were resolved, SDMI runtime dropped dramatically—without additional hardware.

Results Achieved

After re-architecting SDMI execution and applying targeted corrections:

  • SDMI runtime reduced from multiple days to hours

  • SUM downtime became predictable and repeatable

  • Business validation started on schedule

  • SDMI classes completed cleanly with correct completion status

Most importantly, upgrade confidence increased across subsequent cycles because execution behavior was no longer unpredictable.

Key Lessons Learned

From this experience, a few lessons stand out clearly:

  • SDMI must be planned as part of upgrade architecture, not treated as a technical afterthought

  • SUM downtime should be protected aggressively—do not allow large SDMI classes to run blindly

  • Database query behavior matters more than raw CPU or memory

  • Selective SDMI execution is the most effective lever for downtime reduction

  • Production-like sandbox testing is essential for timeline accuracy

Conclusion

Silent Data Migration Interface can either enable a smooth S/4HANA upgrade—or quietly derail it. The difference lies not in hardware sizing, but in architectural decisions about where and how SDMI executes.

By decoupling heavy SDMI classes from SUM, focusing on database-centric optimization, and treating SDMI as a first-class upgrade workstream, even the largest enterprise systems can achieve predictable, business-friendly upgrade timelines and this comes within Business downtime timelines.

entry.title: Sales order creation from cxml document
entry.content:
Hello,

We have one customer who is using a P2P solution which is able to send his purchase order as PO Cxml message. The objective is to create a sales document (sales order or sales quotation #S4/HANA SD#) using this cxml document.

I know we can deliver using ABAP code but I didn't find any standard way to proceed. I have even looked into SAP Business Network but resources related to sell side is not clear. 

Have I missed something ?

entry.title: HR employee master data and HR organizational management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2021
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP team,

We need clarification on whether the use of HR employee master data and HR organizational management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2021 (product 8010833 RISE with S/4HANA Cloud, private edition) is included in the core and therefore already licensed, or whether it requires an additional license via a line-of-business (LoB) solution.

Based on our understanding of the business scope (here - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition based on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03-), we assume that:

• Organizational management is included/assigned within S/4HANA Enterprise Management "Organizational Management" and

• HR master data is included/assigned within S/4HANA Enterprise Management "HR Administration".

If these two features require additional licensing, please provide us with the necessary products, including their material numbers.

KR,

Michael

entry.title: We need batch creation for existing material
entry.content:
Hi experts,

we want batch creation for our existing materials type like spare, consumable etc. please extend your support to fulfil the requirement.

entry.title: External vendor fields: CI_ include or separate append?
entry.content:
Hi all,

short question onbest practices:

How do you handle it when an external vendor needs additional fields in SAP standard structures/tables?

  • Option 1:
    Add the fields to the existing CI_ include next to the customer fields. In our case, it's table KLAH, so we would add the field to CI_KLAH.
  • Option 2:
    Create a separate vendor append (in several places if necessary). In our case, it would be something like /<vendor name space>/AKLAH.

How do you handle this in terms of maintenance, upgrades, and vendor ownership? Is there a published best practice by SAP?

Thanks!

entry.title: PO Creation ME21N
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

While creating a PO in ME21N, I noticed a difference between two company codes:

  • For Plant/Company Code LU27, the dropdown for IC direct cost center is correctly fetching the tax code.

  • For Plant/Company Code MY02, the tax code is not being fetched.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue or can suggest possible reasons for this difference?

Thanks,

Panchalal Yadav

entry.title: Invoice header data without line item is created when executing T-code : ISJP_CR
entry.content:
When executing T-code : ISJP_CR to creating Invoice Summary data, invoice header data without line item was created (i.e. the data in the table ISJPINVSUMHD was created but the one in the table ISJPINVSUMIT was not created). As far as I know, more than one AR line item is linked to invoice header data. 

Can you figure out why such a strange thing occurs and let me know how the thing  does not make it happen?

entry.title: Manage Production Orders app save as tile - Dynamic count does not refresh
entry.content: Hi all. Question, we are in S4H 2023 Private Cloud. In app Manage Production Orders (F2336), you can execute the report and save the report as a Tile. The tile contains a live count similar to many other apps with the same function. The counts on the other apps do refresh, but the Manage Production Orders app does not. I've opened a note with SAP but they have not been helpful yet. Does anyone else have issues with this? Is this function working for anyone else using S4H 2023? Thank you!

entry.title: Real-Time Analytics with SAP S/4HANA: What Actually Works in Emerging Economies?
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA, HANA, and SAP Analytics Cloud promise real-time, data-driven decision-making - but implementation realities can vary widely, especially in emerging economies.

From a hands-on perspective:

  • Which SAP analytics architectures (embedded analytics, SAC, BTP integrations) have worked best for you?
  • How do you handle data quality, performance, and skills constraints?
  • Where have you seen measurable business value (finance, supply chain, public sector)?

Sharing practical experiences, lessons learned, or even pitfalls would be very valuable.

entry.title: Excel Macro Not Working in S/4HANA After Migration to M365
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am facing an issue related to Excel integration in S/4HANA after migrating Microsoft Office to M365.

Previously, we were using a macro-enabled Excel file in .xls format without any problems. However, after the M365 update, we started encountering the error message “SOFFICEINTEGRATION 143.”

Assuming this was related to an Excel version or format issue, we converted the file to .xlsm and tried again. After that change, a different error message appeared: “SOFFICEINTEGRATION 108.”

We have already checked the relevant settings and objects in SMW0 and DC30, but we could not identify any obvious issues.

Could you please advise what might be causing this problem in an S/4HANA environment, especially in relation to M365 and Excel macro handling?

entry.title: Migration / Conversion tools to RISE and Hyperscaler
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

1) What are all the possible migration methods available for ECC 6.0 to S/4HANA Private cloud and Public cloud ?...Can it be done by SAP only?

2) what are the migration tools and methods available for ECC on-prem to S/4HANA conversion  (Azure/AWS/GCP)

3) Migration/conversion specific tools to  (Azure/AWS/GCP) for NW on-prem.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Inquiry about how to use the EXECUTE_UPDATE method of the CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT class
entry.content:
We used the CL_SQL_CONNECTION, CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT, and CL_SQL_STATEMENT classes in an ABAP program for data DELETE & INSERT processing to a specific Oracle DB. (ADBC)

 

However, we discovered that, perhaps because mass data was transmitted, the requested data deletion/insertion does not work. ( Partially, deleted / input was processed. )

 

First, using CL_SQL_CONNECTION->PREPARE_STATEMENT() we defined the SQL.
(Ex) DELETE FROM ... WHERE A = ? and B = ? .... )

Then, using CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->SET_PARAM_TABLE(), we set the data.

Finally, we called CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->EXECUTE_UPDATE().

 

However, we discovered that the intended number of DELETE/INSERT operations were not being processed.

 

When I reduced the number of transmissions, I confirmed that it operates normally.

How can we determine an appropriate size(SET_PARAM_TABLE),

and could you provide any guide documents or sample programs?

entry.title: SAP SD Rebates migration to SAP S4 HANA Settlement Management Open Agreements
entry.content:
My client is migrating from ECC to S/4HANA. They are using both standard rebates and Vistex solution for their business.
SAP recommends to close any open agreements through final settlement and create anew in S/4HANA. My concern is for the open agreements which are only partially through their validity period.
Has anyone carried out the migration of open agreements for rebate and Vistex? What is the approach that can be adopted?

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud to S4HANA Live Connection CDS view access
entry.content:
Hi,

Does an SAC to S/4HANA Live connection provide access to all CDS views in S/4HANA? We have S4HANA Tunnel Connection with SSO.

I understand that only consumption views are visible, but my question is more from a functional access perspective.

For example, we have below views in S4HANA system.

  • 2 views related to OTC,

  • 2 views related to RTR, and

  • 2 views related to STP

I only have access to OTC in S/4HANA:

Will I be able to see all six views in SAC, with no data access on the RTR and STP views?
Or will I only see the two views related to OTC?

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,
Parag

entry.title: Multi‑Payee Scenario – REA2 Condition Type Not Determined
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In the multi‑payee scenario, when the Sold‑to and Bill‑to are different, the system is not determining the REA2 condition type. However, at the contract level under Condition Usage, it does not show any open accruals — all accruals appear as reversed.
Additionally, at the accounting document level, the accrual reversal is also not reflected.

Request you to please share your inputs.

entry.title: IRRF PF - Lei 15.270/2025
entry.content:
Olá, pessoal!!

Alguém que tenha implementado as notas SAP referentes a Lei 15.270/2025 elaborou algum cenário de teste de prestação de seriços por contribuinte individual com incidência IRRF e mais de uma NF no mesmo mês?

Gostaria de saber se os cálculos ficaram corretos e com a devida acumulação.

Grata,

Simone Brito

Consultora SAP FI
